pr_title: issues #1839 and #1743 - support search parameter disambiguation

timeline.message:
issues #1839 and #1743 - support search parameter disambiguation

1. Update ParametersMap to support storing multiple search parameters
with the same code
2. Address #1743 by collecting to a map instead of a list
3. Update SearchUtil.getSearchParameter to lookup the search parameter
by URI from the config if possible (instead of applying the filter to
the full set of built-in parameters).
4. Update the docs to reflect that search parameter filtering now
applies to tenant-specific search parameters as well. This should help
us move toward https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/issues/1596

Also fixed a bad trace message and did some minor formatting / javadoc.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: want to use extension-search-parameters.json instead of extension-search-parameters.xml ?
timeline.author: michaelwschroeder

-     * "built-in" pseudo-tenant-id.
-     * SearchParameters contained in the default tenant's

-     * tenant-specific

-     * a Map<String, Map<String,

-     * map contains the SearchParameters for that resource type, keyed by
-     * SearchParameter name (e.g. "_lastUpdated").
-     * When getSearchParameter(resourceType, name) is called, we'll need to first
-     * search in the current tenant's map,
-     * then if not found, look in the "built-in" tenant's map. Also, when
-     * getSearchParameters(resourceType) is called,

-     * tenant's map (if present) plus those

timeline.message:
issues #1839 and #1743 - support search parameter disambiguation

1. Update ParametersMap to support storing multiple search parameters
with the same code
2. Address #1743 by collecting to a map instead of a list
3. Update SearchUtil.getSearchParameter to lookup the search parameter
by URI from the config if possible (instead of applying the filter to
the full set of built-in parameters).
4. Update the docs to reflect that search parameter filtering now
applies to tenant-specific search parameters as well. This should help
us move toward https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/issues/1596

Also fixed a bad trace message and did some minor formatting / javadoc.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Minor. This Set is mutable. Could make this immutable on return. That may have performance implications given how much this stuff gets used. Perhaps use a custom class which is a HashSet and implements an interface with only the getters you need.
timeline.author: punktilious

replies.bodyText: Good call.  I think wrapping the set via Collections.immutableSet should be fine.
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.message:
merge suggestions into rebased branch

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Add unit tests for the ParametersMap

Also made a minor change to insertAll so it gets the code from the
existing ParametersMap instead of from the SearchParameters in the map.
Usually these are the same, but they can differ.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Add unit tests for the ParametersMap

Also made a minor change to insertAll so it gets the code from the
existing ParametersMap instead of from the SearchParameters in the map.
Usually these are the same, but they can differ.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
